H0.text: Producer is the type of organism that helps return nutrients from dead plants and animals to the soil.

H1.text: Prey helps return nutrients from dead plants and animals to the soil.

H2.text: Predators are organisms that help return nutrients from dead plants and animals to the soil.

H3.text: Decomposer is an organism that helps return nutrients from dead plants and animals to the soil.

A4.text: Decomposers are organisms that break down dead organisms and release the nutrients from the dead matter into the environment around them.

A5.text: Decomposition is the process of breaking large molecules in dead matter down into smaller molecules that nearby plants are able to take up through their roots.
